intro: Billotia marginata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf billotia, is a flowering plant native to the wet tropical regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a distinctive white margin. It produces small, pale green flowers that are typically clustered in spikes. Billotia marginata is often found in coastal and rainforest habitats, where it thrives in moist, well-drained soils.
